item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Finalised Today: Know Latest GMP, How To Check Allotment Status Online - News18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Finalised Today: Know Latest GMP, How To Check Allotment Status Online

Last Updated: December 16, 2024, 17:20 IST

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment has been finalised, and investors can expect confirmation via bank debit messages. The IPO has garnered significant interest, with a high subscription rate across categories.

  • The IPO was open for subscription from December 11 to 13 and was oversubscribed 28.75 times.
  • Latest grey market premium (GMP) stands at 24.36%, trading at Rs 97.
  • The allotment notification will be sent out by December 16 evening.
  • Shares will be listed on BSE and NSE on December 18.
“The IPO price band was set at Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share, with considerable interest across all categories.”

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO reflects strong investor confidence, making it a significant event in India's retail market.

item.title: High-fibre plant-based diet may stop progression of incurable cancer - The Times of India
item.description:
High-fibre plant-based diet may stop progression of incurable cancer

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

This article discusses recent findings that suggest a high-fibre plant-based diet could potentially slow down or halt the progression of incurable cancers, offering hope to those affected.

  • The study highlights the correlation between dietary fibre intake and cancer progression.
  • There is an emphasis on the importance of plant-based foods in cancer management.
  • Patients reported improvements in their condition following dietary changes.
“A diet rich in fibre may open new pathways for cancer treatment.”

The findings suggest that dietary intervention could become an integral part of cancer care, providing a non-invasive strategy for patients.

item.title: Atul Subhash suicide case: Allahabad HC grants anticipatory bail to Nikita Singhania's uncle - The Times of India
item.description:
Atul Subhash suicide case: Allahabad HC grants anticipatory bail to Nikita Singhania's uncle

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: Times of India

The Allahabad High Court has granted anticipatory bail to Sushil Singhania, the uncle of Nikita Singhania, in a case related to the suicide of Artificial Intelligence engineer Atul Subhash. The ruling follows arrests of Nikita and her family members for allegedly abetting the suicide.

  • The court ruled that Sushil Singhania is entitled to pre-arrest anticipatory bail.
  • Police had arrested Nikita, her mother, and brother based on a suicide note and an online video.
  • The court hearing emphasized that Sushil Singhania, who is 69 years old with chronic health issues, could not have abetted the act.
  • Conditions of bail include availability for police interrogation and restrictions on leaving India.
“Considering the above, the court is of the opinion that applicant Sushil Singhania is entitled to get the privilege of pre-arrest (Transit) Anticipatory.”

This ruling underscores the court's consideration of the evidence and the circumstances surrounding the case, aiming to balance justice with the individual's health and legal rights.

item.title: SpaceX’s 31st Dragon cargo capsule departs ISS to head home to Earth - Space.com
item.description:
SpaceX's 31st Dragon Cargo Capsule Departs ISS to Head Home to Earth

Date: December 16, 2023 | Source: Space.com

SpaceX's 31st robotic cargo mission is on its way back to Earth, after successfully undocking from the International Space Station (ISS) this morning.

  • The Dragon cargo capsule undocked at 11:05 a.m. EST, beginning deorbit burns to complete its mission.
  • It will splash down off the coast of Florida tomorrow, December 17, with thousands of pounds of equipment and samples from ISS research.
  • The spacecraft is currently the only cargo craft capable of safely returning cargo to Earth, while others incinerate upon reentry.
  • CRS-31 delivered 6,000 pounds of supplies for NASA's astronauts at the ISS in November.
  • NASA can quickly retrieve the Dragon after splashdown to continue research on the returned experiments.
  • Today's undocking was delayed from its original schedule due to bad weather in the splashdown zone.
“NASA will be able to retrieve the CRS-31 Dragon spacecraft relatively quickly after splashdown tomorrow, reaping the benefits of any experiments in need of quick attending following atmospheric reentry.”

This mission is crucial for ongoing research and supply to astronauts on the ISS, highlighting the importance of commercial partnerships in space exploration.

item.title: GRAP-4 Restrictions Reimposed In Delhi As Air Quality Dips To 'Severe+' - NDTV
item.description:
GRAP-4 Restrictions Reimposed In Delhi As Air Quality Dips To 'Severe+'

Publication Date: Recent

Source: NDTV

Delhi's air quality has worsened, dropping into the 'Severe+' category, leading to the imposition of GRAP 4 restrictions by the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM).

Key Points:

  • Ban on BS IV Diesel and BS III Petrol cars in Delhi-NCR.
  • Implementation of GRAP 4 due to an AQI breach over 400.
  • Restrictions include stopping truck traffic, banning construction activities, and limiting office attendance.
  • Emergency measures for schools with hybrid classes starting from 9 am due to air pollution and cold.
  • Public health warnings due to deteriorating air quality.
“Considering the steep rise in the AQI of Delhi owing to highly unfavourable meteorological conditions...” - CAQM Sub-Committee

The re-imposition of GRAP restrictions highlights the ongoing air quality crisis in Delhi, necessitating immediate and effective action to protect public health.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session: 'One Nation, One Poll' bill likely to be introduced in LS tomorrow - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session: 'One Nation, One Poll' Bill to Be Introduced in Lok Sabha Tomorrow

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The 'One Nation One Election' bill is set to be introduced in the Lok Sabha tomorrow around noon, as the Parliament Winter Session approaches its conclusion.

  • The final week of the Winter Session has started with discussions on the Constitution.
  • Simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state assemblies are the core objective of the new bill.
  • Other bills concerning Union Territories are also expected to be introduced this week.
“Both houses adjourned till 11 am tomorrow.”

As the nation watches, this legislative move could potentially reshape the electoral landscape in India.

item.title: Ding Liren, Accused Of Deliberately Losing To D Gukesh, Opens Up On World Chess Championship Defeat - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ding Liren, Accused Of Deliberately Losing To D Gukesh, Opens Up On World Chess Championship Defeat

Publication Date: December 11, 2024 • Source: NDTV

Chinese Grandmaster Ding Liren has spoken about his recent loss to India’s D Gukesh at the 2024 World Chess Championship, where Gukesh, at a young age, became the world champion. Ding faced criticism after making a significant mistake in the final game.

  • Ding Liren was the defending champion at the World Chess Championship 2024.
  • He made a key error in Game 14, allowing Gukesh to win.
  • Andrei Filatov alleged Ding deliberately lost, prompting calls for an investigation.
  • Former champions Magnus Carlsen and Vladimir Kramnik critiqued the match's quality.
  • Ding defended his moves and insisted on the quality of the games.
  • Gukesh won the match with 7.5 points, claiming a prize of USD 1.3 million.
“Yes, I tried my best in the match... I can say that I played some high quality moves when I spent a lot of time.” - Ding Liren

This championship match showcased the talent and determination of both players, with Gukesh's victory marking a significant moment in chess history.

item.title: Brisbane Weather Forecast, India vs Australia 3rd Test: Can Rain Save India From Humiliation At The Gabba? - News18
item.description:
Brisbane Weather Forecast, India vs Australia 3rd Test: Can Rain Save India From Humiliation At The Gabba?

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: News18

India's chances of taking a lead in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy diminish due to rain disruptions at the Gabba. With 51 runs and 4 wickets down, India's struggle against Australia continues amidst unfavorable weather predictions.

  • Brisbane experienced heavy rain, impacting the progress of the cricket match.
  • On Days 4 and 5, showers could interrupt play, potentially benefiting India.
  • India's top order has faltered, with significant pressure on players like Rohit Sharma and Ravindra Jadeja.
  • Weather forecasts predict rain during critical match timings, including thunderstorms on Wednesday.
“Avoiding the follow-on would have to be the first target.” - Expert Analysis

The intermittent rain at Gabba poses both challenges and potential advantages for the Indian cricket team as they strive to avoid humiliation.

item.title: Unexpected colon cancer warning: This change in stool thickness could signal trouble - The Times of India
item.description:
Unexpected Colon Cancer Warning: Change in Stool Thickness Could Signal Trouble

Date & Source: The Times of India

Colorectal cancer is on the rise, especially among young people under 50 in the United States. The number of young adults diagnosed with colorectal cancer has almost doubled in the past decade, with lifestyle and environmental factors being major contributors.

  1. Colorectal cancer rates are increasing among young adults.
  2. Lifestyle and environmental factors are key contributors.
  3. Pencil-thin stools can be a symptom of colorectal cancer if accompanied by other symptoms.
  4. Other symptoms include changes in bowel habits, blood in stool, and unexplained weight loss.
The misconception that 'low caliber stool' or 'pencil-thin stool' is a reliable sign of colorectal cancer (CRC) originated in the late 19th century and, despite being dismissed by mid-20th-century gastroenterology experts, has persisted in modern medical textbooks.

While pencil-thin stools alone are not a conclusive sign of colon cancer, they can indicate the disease when accompanied by other symptoms. It's important to consult a healthcare provider if you notice changes in your toilet habits.

item.title: Salman Khan, Rashmika Mandanna's Sikandar Teaser To Drop On Superstar's 59th Birthday On Dec 27 - News18
item.description:
Sikandar Teaser to Release on Salman Khan's 59th Birthday

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

Salman Khan's fans will be thrilled as the teaser for Sikandar is set to premiere on the superstar's 59th birthday, December 27, 2024. Directed by A.R. Murugadoss, the film also stars Rashmika Mandanna and has been highly anticipated by fans.

  • The teaser will be released on December 27, coinciding with Salman Khan's birthday.
  • The film marks the reunion of Salman Khan and producer Sajid Nadiadwala after their successful collaboration on Kick in 2014.
  • The first look poster for Sikandar is also expected to be revealed on the same day.
  • The film is set for an Eid 2025 release with plans for a marketing campaign throughout the year.
“Sikandar is among the most awaited films of 2025, and the makers are setting the tone right to welcome the new year with a teaser.”

This teaser release is not just a gift for fans but is part of a larger marketing strategy leading up to the movie's release.

item.title: India, China Special Representatives to hold talks in Beijing on December 18: Chinese Foreign Ministry - The Hindu
item.description:
India, China Special Representatives to hold talks in Beijing on December 18: Chinese Foreign Ministry

Published on: December 16, 2024 09:45 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Special Representatives of India and China will meet in Beijing on December 18, 2024, to discuss restoring bilateral ties after a recent agreement to disengage troops in eastern Ladakh.

  • Director Wang Yi and NSA Ajit Doval will hold the 23rd meeting on the China-India Boundary Question.
  • The meeting follows a five-year gap since the last one in 2019.
  • Efforts aim to normalize relations strained since April 2020.
  • Trade remains the only area of cooperation amidst rising tensions.
“The two sides have reached resolutions on relevant matters, which China speaks highly of.” - Chinese Foreign Ministry

The upcoming talks are crucial for both nations to build upon recently agreed resolutions and enhance diplomatic relations.

item.title: Zakir Hussain, legendary Indian tabla musician, dies aged 73 - The Guardian
item.description:
Zakir Hussain, Legendary Indian Tabla Musician, Dies Aged 73

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

Zakir Hussain, one of India’s most accomplished classical musicians, has passed away at the age of 73 due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, leaving a significant legacy as a cultural ambassador.

  • Hussain was known as the most recognizable tabla player in the world.
  • His career spanned six decades, collaborating with international artists across various genres.
  • He was a child prodigy and began performing alongside legends at a young age.
  • Founded the Indian jazz fusion band Shakti with John McLaughlin.
  • First Indian musician to win three Grammy awards in 2024.
  • A recipient of the Padma Vibhushan, India’s second-highest civilian award, in 2023.
  • Hussain composed film scores and acted in movies while promoting Indian culture globally.
“He leaves behind an unparalleled legacy as a cultural ambassador and one of the greatest musicians of all time.”

The death of Zakir Hussain marks the end of an era in Indian classical music. His contributions will inspire future generations of musicians.

item.title: KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race - NDTV
item.description:
KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race

Date: March 26, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A corruption case has been filed against KT Rama Rao, the former minister of Telangana, over alleged irregularities linked to the 2023 Formula E race held in Hyderabad.

  • The Anti-Corruption Bureau alleges a transfer of ₹55 crore to the event organizers occurred on the verbal orders of Mr. Rao.
  • Former principal secretary Arvind Kumar admitted to transferring funds without cabinet approval and circumventing the Election Commission's permission.
  • The payment allegedly occurred in pounds without Reserve Bank of India clearance.
  • Mr. Rao claims he is being targeted by the current Congress government following a political shift.
  • The next Formula E scheduled for February 2024 was canceled after the Congress came to power.
“I am being targeted by the Congress government” - KT Rama Rao

The ongoing investigation raises questions about the accountability of political figures in financial matters and their oversight in public fund management.

item.title: 'Won't let anyone threaten India's security': Sri Lankan president's promise to PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sri Lankan President's Commitment to India's Security During New Delhi Visit

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: HT News Desk

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Disanayaka has pledged during his visit to India that no force will be allowed to use Sri Lankan territory to threaten India's security, emphasizing strong defense cooperation between the nations.

  • The meeting between Disanayaka and Prime Minister Modi aims to strengthen ties amid growing concerns about China's influence in the region.
  • Disanayaka reiterated Sri Lanka's commitment to support India, fostering further cooperation.
  • India and Sri Lanka are planning new initiatives, including an electricity grid and a petroleum pipeline, to enhance economic relations.
  • The backdrop of the visit includes Sri Lanka's economic crisis and China's aggressive presence in the Indo-Pacific.
“The cooperation with India will certainly flourish and I want to reassure our continued support for India,” Disanayaka stated at a press briefing.

The visit is significant as it symbolizes the strengthening of India-Sri Lanka relations in light of regional security concerns, particularly regarding China's actions in the Indian Ocean.

item.title: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz loses confidence vote, early election in February - The Times of India
item.description:
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz loses confidence vote, early election in February

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: Times of India

German Chancellor Olaf Scholz lost a confidence vote in parliament, resulting in early elections slated for February 23. This follows the collapse of his coalition government, leaving him to head a minority administration.

  • Scholz secured only 207 votes out of 733 in the Bundestag, significantly below the required 367 for a majority.
  • The vote was mandated by Germany's constitution, which prohibits the self-dissolution of parliament.
  • President Frank-Walter Steinmeier is expected to dissolve parliament after Christmas, adhering to the planned election date.
  • Scholz's government collapsed following internal disputes over economic reforms.
  • His political opponent, Friedrich Merz, criticized him for mismanaging the economy during a crisis.
  • The election campaign is already active, with Scholz's Social Democrats currently trailing in the polls.
  • Scholz emphasized the need for stability, stating the upcoming election is crucial for the country's future investments.
“You’re leaving the country in one of its biggest economic crises in postwar history.” - Friedrich Merz

This confidence vote is only the sixth in Germany's postwar history, marking a significant political shift and potential instability.

item.description:
After Rahul vs Mamata leadership tussle, it is now EVM divide in opposition INDIA bloc

Publication Date: [Date not provided]
Source: [Source not provided]

The opposition India bloc is facing internal strife following a leadership tussle between Rahul Gandhi and Mamata Banerjee, now escalating into disagreements over electronic voting machines (EVMs).

  • Tensions have risen among opposition leaders regarding the reliability of EVMs.
  • Leadership disagreements primarily center around election strategy and candidate selection.
  • This divide could impact the bloc's effectiveness in the upcoming elections.
"The EVM issue could undermine the trust in the electoral process."

The tensions within the opposition bloc highlight significant challenges as they prepare for future elections, revealing cracks in their unity.

item.title: Tempers fly after Mahayuti cabinet expansion. Left out, Bhujbal says 'reward for taking on Jarange Patil' - ThePrint
item.description:
Mahayuti Cabinet Expansion Sparks Controversy Among Leaders

Date: Not specified Source: ThePrint

The Mahayuti government's recent cabinet expansion has resulted in backlash from key alliance figures, including NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal and Shiv Sena's Vijay Shivtare, following the exclusion of several senior leaders.

  • The cabinet expansion introduced 39 new ministers, including 19 from BJP and 11 from Shiv Sena.
  • Bhujbal expressed his disappointment at being dropped and rejected a Rajya Sabha nomination, indicating it caused a breach of trust.
  • Shivtare criticized the leadership for not keeping party members informed about the cabinet decisions.
  • Discontent among dropped leaders remains, despite claims from others that they accept the party’s decision.
“I am a common karyakarta, how does it matter if I am sidestepped or cast aside?” - Chhagan Bhujbal

The situation highlights the tensions within the Mahayuti coalition as it seeks to manage party dynamics ahead of upcoming elections.

item.title: Papon remembers Ustad Zakir Hussain: 'A personal and musical loss' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Papon mourns Ustad Zakir Hussain, calling his loss heartbreaking and a personal void, as they had planned a collaboration next year

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The world of music has been left reeling after the passing of tabla maestro Ustad Zakir Hussain, who succumbed to complications from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis at the age of 73. Zakir breathed his last in San Francisco, US on Monday, leaving behind an unparalleled legacy that transcended genres and borders.

  • Papon expressed deep grief over Zakir Hussain's passing, describing it as shocking and heartbreaking.
  • The Assam-born musician had planned a collaboration with Hussain next year.
  • Zakir Hussain was a virtuoso tabla player known for introducing Indian classical music to global audiences.
“This is truly shocking & heartbreaking! His playing was at its absolute peak! What a tremendous loss for the world of music and an incredibly personal loss for me,” Papon shared.
“For me, he was the perfect example of dignity and greatness, and it’s hard to believe he’s gone,” Papon added.

The legacy of Ustad Zakir Hussain lives on through his monumental contributions to the world of music and the countless individuals he inspired.

item.title: 7 Most Beautiful Space Images Captured By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
item.description:
7 Most Beautiful Space Images Captured By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Times Now

This article showcases the most breathtaking images obtained from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting the beauty and mystery of our universe through celestial phenomena.

  • Cone Nebula: Resembles a mythical creature and is found in the star-forming region NGC 2264.
  • AG Carinae: A massive star surrounded by a shell of gas and dust, caught in an epic battle between gravity and radiation.
  • Festive Nebulae: NGC 248 dazzles from 200,000 light-years away, showcasing brilliant color and structure.
  • NGC 5189: A colorful cosmic ribbon featuring a stunning stellar eruption.
  • Lagoon Nebula: A hub of vigorous star formation in a sea of gas and dust.
  • Galaxies IC 2163 and NGC 2207: A mesmerizing cosmic encounter captured using different light spectrums.
  • Tarantula Nebula: An intense stellar activity scene found in the Large Magellanic Cloud.
“These images not only demonstrate the beauty of the cosmos but also the scientific advancements that allow us to explore these wonders.” - Sparsh Sharma

The vivid images provided by the Hubble Space Telescope continue to inspire curiosity and awe about the vast universe we inhabit, making it essential for both scientific community and enthusiasts alike.

item.title: Study Challenges Myths About Cannabis, Brain Health, and IQ - Neuroscience News
item.description:
Study Challenges Myths About Cannabis, Brain Health, and IQ

Date & Source: Published on: Not specified, Source: Neuroscience News

A groundbreaking Danish study tracking over 5,000 men for 44 years found that cannabis users experienced slightly less cognitive decline from early adulthood to late midlife compared to nonusers. These findings challenge previous assumptions about cannabis and its impact on cognitive aging.

Key Points:

  • Cognitive Decline: Cannabis users experienced 1.3 IQ points less decline over 44 years compared to nonusers.
  • Initiation Age: Starting cannabis before age 18 had no significant effect on long-term cognitive decline.
  • Frequency of Use: Regular cannabis use (≥2 times per week) was not associated with greater cognitive decline.

Cannabis, often maligned for its short-term cognitive effects, may not have the long-term impact on mental sharpness once thought.

While the observed differences were minor and might lack clinical significance, the research opens the door for further exploration of cannabis’ long-term effects on cognition.

item.title: ‘Found ourselves at odds’: Canada’s deputy PM Chrystia Freeland resigns citing rift with Trudeau - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Found ourselves at odds’: Canada’s deputy PM Chrystia Freeland resigns citing rift with Trudeau

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: [News Source]

In a surprising political move, Chrystia Freeland, Canada's Deputy Prime Minister, has resigned, citing a significant rift with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. This decision marks a notable shift in the Canadian political landscape.

  • Freeland's resignation comes after tensions have escalated within the Liberal Party.
  • Concerns about policy disagreements have reportedly been a contributing factor.
  • The resignation is expected to have immediate implications for the Trudeau government.

item.title: Canada’s deputy PM resigns after policy clash with PM Trudeau - The Indian Express
item.description:
Canada’s Deputy PM Chrystia Freeland Resigns Over Policy Disagreement with Trudeau

Published on: Monday
Source: Indian Express

Canada’s deputy prime minister Chrystia Freeland resigned unexpectedly on Monday, citing differences with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau over the country’s direction.

  • Freeland, also serving as Finance Minister, resigned hours before presenting the fall economic update to Parliament.
  • The update was anticipated to reveal a larger budget deficit for 2023/24 than previously planned.
  • Freeland highlighted serious economic threats from the incoming U.S. administration's nationalist policies, including potential tariffs.
  • In her resignation letter, she cautioned against using political gimmicks that could erode public confidence.
  • Freeland stated that Trudeau offered her a different Cabinet position, but she chose to resign instead.
“For the last number of weeks, you and I have found ourselves at odds over the best path forward for Canada.” - Chrystia Freeland

Freeland's resignation marks a significant shift in Trudeau's cabinet and raises questions about the government's approach to economic challenges.
